intro: Cryptantha pterocarya f. pseudocycloptera, commonly known as the Sierra cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in mountainous regions. Its leaves are linear to lanceolate, and the flowers are usually pale purple or white. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
